sections.heading: What is こと Nominalization?
sections.content:
こと nominalization turns verbs and clauses into abstract noun concepts by adding こと after the plain form. While similar to の, こと is more formal and often used for general statements, facts, and in fixed expressions. It means "thing," "matter," "fact," or "act."

泳ぐことができる "Can swim" (Lit: Swimming is possible) 勉強することは大切だ "Studying is important" 彼が来たことを知っている "I know the fact that he came"

children.heading: [Plain form] + こと
children.content: 食べる + こと → 食べること "Eating / to eat" 難しい + こと → 難しいこと "Difficult thing / being difficult" Creates abstract noun

children.heading: Functions as noun phrase
children.content: 読むことが好き "I like reading" Subject or object position

children.heading: Abstract concepts
children.content: 学ぶことは大切だ "Learning is important" 努力することが必要だ "Making an effort is necessary" General statements

children.heading: Facts and information
children.content: 彼が来たことを知っている "I know that he came" 雨が降ることを忘れた "I forgot that it would rain" Factual knowledge

children.heading: Experiences
children.content: 日本に行ったことがある "I have been to Japan" 寿司を食べたことがない "I have never eaten sushi" Experience pattern

children.heading: 〜ことができる (can/able to)
children.content: 泳ぐことができる "Can swim" 日本語を話すことができます "I can speak Japanese" Ability expression

children.heading: 〜ことがある (have experience)
children.content: 行ったことがある "I have been (there)" 見たことがない "I have never seen" Experience marker

children.heading: 〜ことにする (decide to)
children.content: 行くことにした "I decided to go" やめることにする "I'll decide to quit" Decision making

children.heading: 〜ことになる (it's decided/arranged)
children.content: 転勤することになった "It was decided I'll transfer" 会議は中止になることになった "The meeting ended up being canceled" External decision

children.heading: は for topic
children.content: 大切なことは努力だ "What's important is effort" 問題なことは時間だ "What's problematic is time" Emphasis structure

children.heading: が for subject
children.content: 走ることが好きだ "I like running" Neutral subject

children.heading: こと itself is neutral
children.content: Casual: 読むことが好きだ "I like reading" Polite: 読むことが好きです "I like reading" Formality in ending

children.heading: As subject
children.content: 勉強することは大切だ "Studying is important" Topic/subject position

children.heading: As object
children.content: 泳ぐことができる "Can swim" Object of できる

children.heading: こと more formal
children.content: 泳ぐことが好き "I like swimming" (formal) More written style

children.heading: の more conversational
children.content: 泳ぐのが好き "I like swimming" (casual) More spoken

children.heading: Fixed patterns use こと
children.content: Must use こと: - ことができる - ことがある - ことにする - ことになる Cannot substitute の

children.heading: Known information
children.content: 彼が医者だということを知っている "I know the fact that he's a doctor" 雨が降ることは確かだ "It's certain that it will rain" Factual statements

children.heading: べきこと (should)
children.content: すべきことがたくさんある "There are many things I should do" するべきことをする "Do what should be done" Obligations

children.heading: 〜こと (written commands)
children.content: 静かにすること "Be quiet" (written rule) 遅刻しないこと "Don't be late" (instruction) Rule/regulation style

children.heading: Stating importance
children.content: 健康であることは大切だ "Being healthy is important" 時間を守ることが重要だ "Keeping time is important" Value statements

children.heading: Expressing ability
children.content: 運転することができる "Can drive" 日本語を読むことができます "I can read Japanese" Capability

children.heading: Talking about experiences
children.content: 富士山に登ったことがある "I have climbed Mt. Fuji" 納豆を食べたことがありますか "Have you ever eaten natto?" Life experiences

children.heading: い-adjectives
children.content: 難しいことを学ぶ "Learn difficult things" 楽しいことが好き "I like fun things" Direct connection

children.heading: な-adjectives
children.content: 大切なこと "Important things" 便利なこと "Convenient things" な connects

children.heading: Present/future
children.content: 行くことができる "Can go" 食べることが好き "I like eating" Dictionary form

children.heading: Past
children.content: 行ったことがある "Have been" 食べたことを覚えている "Remember eating" た-form

children.heading: Negative verbs
children.content: 行かないことにした "Decided not to go" 食べないことがある "Sometimes don't eat" ない-form + こと

children.heading: Using の in fixed patterns
children.content: Wrong: 泳ぐのができる ⚠️ Correct: 泳ぐことができる ✓ "Can swim" Must use こと with できる

children.heading: Confusing ことがある patterns
children.content: Experience: 行ったことがある "Have been" Sometimes: 行くことがある "Sometimes go" Different meanings with tense

children.heading: Wrong particle with 好き
children.content: Wrong: 泳ぐことを好き ⚠️ Correct: 泳ぐことが好き ✓ Use が with 好き

children.heading: こと more in writing
children.content: Written: 読むことは重要です "Reading is important" Formal documents

children.heading: の more in speech
children.content: Spoken: 読むのは重要だ "Reading is important" Casual conversation

children.heading: Listing with こと
children.content: 食べることと飲むこと "Eating and drinking" 勉強することと働くこと "Studying and working" Parallel actions

children.heading: Abstract descriptions
children.content: 面白いこと "Interesting things" 変なこと "Strange things" 難しいこと "Difficult things" General concepts

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 泳ぐことができる "Can swim" 日本に行ったことがある "I have been to Japan" 早く寝ることは大切だ "Sleeping early is important" 勉強することが好き "I like studying" 行かないことにした "I decided not to go"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 日本語を勉強することは難しいですが、とても面白いです "Studying Japanese is difficult, but very interesting" 毎日運動することは健康にいいと思います "I think exercising every day is good for health" 富士山に登ったことがありますか "Have you ever climbed Mt. Fuji?" 彼が日本に来ることになった "It was decided that he will come to Japan" 新しい仕事を始めることができて嬉しい "I'm happy that I can start a new job"
